trans-unit.source: Create a web app in Azure that connects to MongoDB running on a virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Create a web app in Azure that connects to MongoDB running on a virtual machine

trans-unit.source: A tutorial that teaches you how to use Git to deploy an ASP.NET app to Azure App Service, connected to MongoDB on an Azure Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: A tutorial that teaches you how to use Git to deploy an ASP.NET app to Azure App Service, connected to MongoDB on an Azure Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Create a web app in Azure that connects to MongoDB running on a virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Create a web app in Azure that connects to MongoDB running on a virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Using Git, you can deploy an ASP.NET application to Azure App Service Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: Using Git, you can deploy an ASP.NET application to Azure App Service Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will build a simple front-end ASP.NET MVC task list application that connects to a MongoDB database running on a virtual machine in Azure.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will build a simple front-end ASP.NET MVC task list application that connects to a MongoDB database running on a virtual machine in Azure.

trans-unit.source: [MongoDB][MongoDB] is a popular open source, high performance NoSQL database.
trans-unit.target: [MongoDB][MongoDB] is a popular open source, high performance NoSQL database.

trans-unit.source: After running and testing the ASP.NET application on your development computer, you will upload the application to App Service Web Apps using Git.
trans-unit.target: After running and testing the ASP.NET application on your development computer, you will upload the application to App Service Web Apps using Git.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: Background knowledge
trans-unit.target: Background knowledge

trans-unit.source: Knowledge of the following is useful for this tutorial, though not required:
trans-unit.target: Knowledge of the following is useful for this tutorial, though not required:

trans-unit.source: The C# driver for MongoDB.
trans-unit.target: The C# driver for MongoDB.

trans-unit.source: For more information on developing C# applications against MongoDB, see the MongoDB [CSharp Language Center][MongoC#LangCenter].
trans-unit.target: For more information on developing C# applications against MongoDB, see the MongoDB [CSharp Language Center][MongoC#LangCenter].

trans-unit.source: The ASP .NET web application framework.
trans-unit.target: The ASP .NET web application framework.

trans-unit.source: You can learn all about it at the [ASP.net website][ASP.NET].
trans-unit.target: You can learn all about it at the [ASP.net website][ASP.NET].

trans-unit.source: The ASP .NET MVC web application framework.
trans-unit.target: The ASP .NET MVC web application framework.

trans-unit.source: You can learn all about it at the [ASP.NET MVC website][MVCWebSite].
trans-unit.target: You can learn all about it at the [ASP.NET MVC website][MVCWebSite].

trans-unit.source: Azure.
trans-unit.target: Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can get started reading at [Azure][WindowsAzure].
trans-unit.target: You can get started reading at [Azure][WindowsAzure].

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: [Visual Studio Express 2013 for Web] [VSEWeb] or [Visual Studio 2013] [VSUlt]
trans-unit.target: [Visual Studio Express 2013 for Web] [VSEWeb] or [Visual Studio 2013] [VSUlt]

trans-unit.source: Azure SDK for .NET
trans-unit.target: Azure SDK for .NET

trans-unit.source: An active Microsoft Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: An active Microsoft Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: Create a virtual machine and install MongoDB
trans-unit.target: Create a virtual machine and install MongoDB

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes you have created a virtual machine in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes you have created a virtual machine in Azure.

trans-unit.source: After creating the virtual machine you need to install MongoDB on the virtual machine:
trans-unit.target: After creating the virtual machine you need to install MongoDB on the virtual machine:

trans-unit.source: To create a Windows virtual machine and install MongoDB, see [Install MongoDB on a virtual machine running Windows Server in Azure][InstallMongoOnWindowsVM].
trans-unit.target: To create a Windows virtual machine and install MongoDB, see [Install MongoDB on a virtual machine running Windows Server in Azure][InstallMongoOnWindowsVM].

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, to create a Linux virtual machine and install MongoDB, see [Install MongoDB on a virtual machine running CentOS Linux in Azure][InstallMongoOnCentOSLinuxVM].
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, to create a Linux virtual machine and install MongoDB, see [Install MongoDB on a virtual machine running CentOS Linux in Azure][InstallMongoOnCentOSLinuxVM].

trans-unit.source: After you have created the virtual machine in Azure and installed MongoDB, be sure to remember the DNS name of the virtual machine ("testlinuxvm.cloudapp.net", for example) and the external port for MongoDB that you specified in the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: After you have created the virtual machine in Azure and installed MongoDB, be sure to remember the DNS name of the virtual machine ("testlinuxvm.cloudapp.net", for example) and the external port for MongoDB that you specified in the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: You will need this information later in the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will need this information later in the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Create the application
trans-unit.target: Create the application

trans-unit.source: In this section you will create an ASP.NET application called "My Task List" by using Visual Studio and perform an initial deployment to Azure App Service Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will create an ASP.NET application called "My Task List" by using Visual Studio and perform an initial deployment to Azure App Service Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: You will run the application locally, but it will connect to your virtual machine on Azure and use the MongoDB instance that you created there.
trans-unit.target: You will run the application locally, but it will connect to your virtual machine on Azure and use the MongoDB instance that you created there.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, click **New Project**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, click **New Project**.

trans-unit.source: Start Page New Project
trans-unit.target: Start Page New Project

trans-unit.source: In the **New Project** window, in the left pane, select **Visual C#**, and then select **Web**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New Project** window, in the left pane, select **Visual C#**, and then select **Web**.

trans-unit.source: In the middle pane, select **ASP.NET Web Application**.
trans-unit.target: In the middle pane, select **ASP.NET Web Application**.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom, name your project "MyTaskListApp," and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom, name your project "MyTaskListApp," and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: New Project Dialog
trans-unit.target: New Project Dialog

trans-unit.source: In the **New ASP.NET Project** dialog box, select **MVC**, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **New ASP.NET Project** dialog box, select **MVC**, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Select MVC Template
trans-unit.target: Select MVC Template

trans-unit.source: If you aren't already signed into Microsoft Azure, you will be prompted to sign in.
trans-unit.target: If you aren't already signed into Microsoft Azure, you will be prompted to sign in.

trans-unit.source: Follow the prompts to sign into Azure.
trans-unit.target: Follow the prompts to sign into Azure.

trans-unit.source: Once you are signed in, you can start configuring your App Service web app.
trans-unit.target: Once you are signed in, you can start configuring your App Service web app.

trans-unit.source: Specify the **Web App name**, **App Service plan**, **Resource group**, and **Region**, then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Specify the **Web App name**, **App Service plan**, **Resource group**, and **Region**, then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: After the project creation completes, wait for the web app to be created in Azure App Service as indicated in the **Azure App Service Activity** window.
trans-unit.target: After the project creation completes, wait for the web app to be created in Azure App Service as indicated in the **Azure App Service Activity** window.

trans-unit.source: Then, click **Publish MyTaskListApp to this Web App now**.
trans-unit.target: Then, click **Publish MyTaskListApp to this Web App now**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Publish**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Publish**.

trans-unit.source: Once your default ASP.NET application is published to Azure App Service Web Apps, it will be launched in the browser.
trans-unit.target: Once your default ASP.NET application is published to Azure App Service Web Apps, it will be launched in the browser.

trans-unit.source: Install the MongoDB C# driver
trans-unit.target: Install the MongoDB C# driver

trans-unit.source: MongoDB offers client-side support for C# applications through a driver, which you need to install on your local development computer.
trans-unit.target: MongoDB offers client-side support for C# applications through a driver, which you need to install on your local development computer.

trans-unit.source: The C# driver is available through NuGet.
trans-unit.target: The C# driver is available through NuGet.

trans-unit.source: To install the MongoDB C# driver:
trans-unit.target: To install the MongoDB C# driver:

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, right-click the **MyTaskListApp** project and select **Manage NuGetPackages**.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, right-click the **MyTaskListApp** project and select **Manage NuGetPackages**.

trans-unit.source: Manage NuGet Packages
trans-unit.target: Manage NuGet Packages

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage NuGet Packages** window, in the left pane, click **Online**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage NuGet Packages** window, in the left pane, click **Online**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Search Online** box on the right, type "mongodb.driver".
trans-unit.target: In the **Search Online** box on the right, type "mongodb.driver".

trans-unit.source: Click **Install** to install the driver.
trans-unit.target: Click **Install** to install the driver.

trans-unit.source: Search for MongoDB C# Driver
trans-unit.target: Search for MongoDB C# Driver

trans-unit.source: Click **I Accept** to accept the 10gen, Inc. license terms.
trans-unit.target: Click **I Accept** to accept the 10gen, Inc. license terms.

trans-unit.source: Click **Close** after the driver has installed.
trans-unit.target: Click **Close** after the driver has installed.

trans-unit.source: ![MongoDB C# Driver Installed][MongoDBCsharpDriverInstalled]
trans-unit.target: ![MongoDB C# Driver Installed][MongoDBCsharpDriverInstalled]

trans-unit.source: The MongoDB C# driver is now installed.
trans-unit.target: The MongoDB C# driver is now installed.

trans-unit.source: References to the **MongoDB.Bson**, **MongoDB.Driver**, and **MongoDB.Driver.Core** libraries have been added to the project.
trans-unit.target: References to the **MongoDB.Bson**, **MongoDB.Driver**, and **MongoDB.Driver.Core** libraries have been added to the project.

trans-unit.source: MongoDB C# Driver References
trans-unit.target: MongoDB C# Driver References

trans-unit.target: Add a model

trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, right-click the *Models* folder and **Add** a new **Class** and name it *TaskModel.cs*.

trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, right-click the *MyTaskListApp* project and **Add** a **New Folder** named *DAL*.

trans-unit.target: Right-click the *DAL* folder and **Add** a new **Class**.

trans-unit.source: Name the class file *Dal.cs*.
trans-unit.target: Name the class file *Dal.cs*.

trans-unit.target: Set up the styles

trans-unit.source: To change the title at the top of the page, open the *Views\Shared\\_Layout.cshtml* file in **Solution Explorer** and replace "Application name" in the navbar header with "My Task List Application" so that it looks like this:
trans-unit.target: To change the title at the top of the page, open the *Views\Shared\\_Layout.cshtml* file in **Solution Explorer** and replace "Application name" in the navbar header with "My Task List Application" so that it looks like this:

trans-unit.target: In order to set up the Task List menu, open the *\Views\Home\Index.cshtml* file and replace the existing code with the following code:

trans-unit.source: To add the ability to create a new task, right-click the *Views\Home\\* folder and **Add** a **View**.
trans-unit.target: To add the ability to create a new task, right-click the *Views\Home\\* folder and **Add** a **View**.

trans-unit.source: Name the view *Create*.
trans-unit.target: Name the view *Create*.

trans-unit.source: **Solution Explorer** should look like this:
trans-unit.target: **Solution Explorer** should look like this:

trans-unit.source: Solution Explorer
trans-unit.target: Solution Explorer

trans-unit.source: Set the MongoDB connection string
trans-unit.target: Set the MongoDB connection string

trans-unit.source: In **Solution Explorer**, open the *DAL/Dal.cs* file.
trans-unit.target: In **Solution Explorer**, open the *DAL/Dal.cs* file.

trans-unit.source: Find the following line of code:
trans-unit.target: Find the following line of code:

trans-unit.source: Replace `<vm-dns-name>` with the DNS name of the virtual machine running MongoDB you created in the [Create a virtual machine and install MongoDB][] step of this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Replace `<vm-dns-name>` with the DNS name of the virtual machine running MongoDB you created in the [Create a virtual machine and install MongoDB][] step of this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: To find the DNS name of your virtual machine, go to the Azure portal, select **Virtual Machines**, and find **DNS Name**.
trans-unit.target: To find the DNS name of your virtual machine, go to the Azure portal, select **Virtual Machines**, and find **DNS Name**.

trans-unit.source: If the DNS name of the virtual machine is "testlinuxvm.cloudapp.net" and MongoDB is listening on the default port 27017, the connection string line of code will look like:
trans-unit.target: If the DNS name of the virtual machine is "testlinuxvm.cloudapp.net" and MongoDB is listening on the default port 27017, the connection string line of code will look like:

trans-unit.source: If the virtual machine endpoint specifies a different external port for MongoDB, you can specifiy the port in the connection string:
trans-unit.target: If the virtual machine endpoint specifies a different external port for MongoDB, you can specifiy the port in the connection string:

trans-unit.source: For more information on MongoDB connection strings, see [Connections][MongoConnectionStrings].
trans-unit.target: For more information on MongoDB connection strings, see [Connections][MongoConnectionStrings].

trans-unit.source: Test the local deployment
trans-unit.target: Test the local deployment

trans-unit.source: To run your application on your development computer, select **Start Debugging** from the **Debug** menu or hit **F5**.
trans-unit.target: To run your application on your development computer, select **Start Debugging** from the **Debug** menu or hit **F5**.

trans-unit.source: IIS Express starts and a browser opens and launches the application's home page.
trans-unit.target: IIS Express starts and a browser opens and launches the application's home page.

trans-unit.source: You can add a new task, which will be added to the MongoDB database running on your virtual machine in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You can add a new task, which will be added to the MongoDB database running on your virtual machine in Azure.

trans-unit.source: My Task List Application
trans-unit.target: My Task List Application

trans-unit.source: Publish to Azure App Service Web Apps
trans-unit.target: Publish to Azure App Service Web Apps

trans-unit.source: In this section you will publish your changes to Azure App Service Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will publish your changes to Azure App Service Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click **MyTaskListApp** again and click **Publish**.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click **MyTaskListApp** again and click **Publish**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Publish**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Publish**.

trans-unit.source: You should now see your web app running in Azure App Service and accessing the MongoDB database in Azure Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: You should now see your web app running in Azure App Service and accessing the MongoDB database in Azure Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: You have now successfully deployed your ASP.NET application to Azure App Service Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: You have now successfully deployed your ASP.NET application to Azure App Service Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: To view the web app:
trans-unit.target: To view the web app:

trans-unit.source: Log into the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Log into the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Click **Web apps**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Web apps**.

trans-unit.source: Select your web app in the **Web Apps** list.
trans-unit.target: Select your web app in the **Web Apps** list.

trans-unit.source: For more information on developing C# applications against MongoDB, see [CSharp Language Center][MongoC#LangCenter].
trans-unit.target: For more information on developing C# applications against MongoDB, see [CSharp Language Center][MongoC#LangCenter].

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
